item.description:
Join Hostelling International for a night full of lively conversation and unique food and drink – all while supporting a great cause! Hostelling International’s Cultural Café series of fundraising dinners is visiting the Rincon Limeno Restaurant in East Boston.

 

Time: Tuesday, August 2nd, 6-8 PM

Place: Rincon Limeno Restaurant - 409 Chelsea Street, East Boston, MA 02128

Fee: $30 includes meal, gratuity, and a donation to Cultural Kitchen

 

You MUST pre-register for this event! Purchase your ticket NOW! You can order a ticket with this link https://co.clickandpledge.com/advanced/default.aspx?wid=39329 or you may also buy tickets offline by contacting Laurine at admin@usahostels.org or at 617-718-7990 ext 10. This is an event you won't want to miss!

The Rincon Limeno Restaurant is located in East Boston, Massachusetts. The quality of their service is only surpassed by the quality of their food. They've been serving the most exquisite Peruvian cuisine and we think it's time that you experience it for yourself.

As you enter let yourself be whisked away by sights, sounds, and aromas… but that is just the beginning. They guarantee one visit will keep you coming again and again. You'll be drawn in by the authentic Peruvian decor as you venture on a gastronomic adventure into the traditional flavors of Peru. The aromas of their delicious dishes will keep you on the edge of your seat and when your food arrives we guarantee every bite will blow you away!

Peruvian cuisine, in addition to its Inca origins, combines Spanish, Asian, and African influences to make an eclectic fusion of indigenous crops, spices, meats and seafood. Fresh ingredients and imaginative sauces are a hallmark of Peruvian cuisine, as is the popular Aji Amarillo pepper. This fruity flavored and aromatic pepper is incorporated into many dishes, adding mild spice and a pleasant yellow color. This pepper can be mixed with oil and used as a flavorful condiment or dipping sauce as well.

More about Cultural Café and Cultural Kitchen:

For over a year, Hostelling International USA’s Cultural Café has been exploring the diverse cultures and cuisines that the Boston-area restaurants have to offer. Cultural Café is an enjoyable meal shared among fellow members of the community, and also raises funds for Cultural Kitchen, Hostelling International’s program for inner-city youth, as well as other educational and outreach programs and initiatives. For all the latest updates, consider joining the Meetup group at www.meetup.com/culturalcafe.

 

As an afterschool activity, Cultural Kitchen teaches Boston area youth about culture and diversity using cooking as the primary vehicle - just like travelers at our hostels learn about one another while cooking together in the hostel kitchen. For more information, please visit www.culturalkitchenboston.org
